definition: overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
night
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)

sentences.english: These rooms would be lighted up every evening.
sentences.chinese: 客房里的房间通宵达旦灯火通明。

sentences.english: He often works round the clock.
sentences.chinese: 他经常通宵达旦地工作。

sentences.english: Reviving the music of the Orchid Islands; a feast, lasting the whole night, from dusk til dawn.
sentences.chinese: 原音重现兰屿音乐夜宴，通宵达旦到天明。

sentences.english: I just wanna be here beside you and stay until the break of dawn .
sentences.chinese: 我只想通宵达旦地在这里守候着你。

sentences.english: On the evening we won the lottery, my wife and I went out and made a night of it.
sentences.chinese: 彩券中奖的那天晚上，我和太太出去通宵达旦。

definition: to be sleepless all night
all night/throughout the night
the whole night
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
day and night/round-the-clock
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to stay up through the night (idiom)
the whole night/all through the night
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
very late at night
past midnight
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
to stay up late or all night
